title: The original Raspberry Pi PC turns 10 years old today
content:
The original Raspberry Pi micro-computer was a smash hit, combining an open Linux-powered ARM system with a super-cheap price point (roughly $35). There have been many models since then, but now the tiny computer that started it all is 10 years old, as of today (February 28). Eben Upton, one of the founders of the

The post The original Raspberry Pi PC turns 10 years old today appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Ferbuary 28 marks the 10-year anniversary of the first Raspberry Pi board, which spawned a product line of super-cheap ARM computers.
